bioghist.p: Donald G. Barnhouse (1895-1960) was a Presbyterian minister and one of the pioneers of radio preaching. He was pastor of the Tenth Presbyterian Church in Philadelphia, president of the Evangelical Foundation in Philadelphia, and editor in chief of Eternity Magazine. He began broadcasting radio sermons in the 1920s, eventually launching his own network program, "The Bible Study Hour." In 1949 he began his famous study of Romans which continued each week for nearly 12 years until his death. This radio program continues to air as "Dr. Barnhouse & the Bible."

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of papers of Donald Barnhouse, including: correspondence; magazine and newspaper clippings; publications, including copies of "Broadcast Notes of the Bible Study Hour"; photographs; minutes, financial and other reports of the Evangelical Foundation; scrapbooks; school notes; reel to reel audio tapes of Barnhouse's addresses and sermons (1960); papers related to several court cases; passports; biographical materials on Barnhouse collected by Paul A. Hopkins; radio sermons; manuscripts for addresses, articles, and books; sympathy letters sent to the "Bible Study Hour" and to Ruth Barnhouse; diaries from Barnhouse's visits to foreign missions; appointment books; and an herbarium. Also included is Barnhouse's personal correspondence, 1913-1927, mainly with relatives, and several publications and other papers relating to his military service during World War I. Images include daguerreotypes and prints of Barnhouse family members; portraits of Barnhouse from 1899 into the 1950s; and other prints documenting Barnhouse's activities and family during the 1920s through 1950s. Post-1960 papers are biographical materials and references to Barnhouse collected by the donor, Paul A. Hopkins. Also within this collection is a bound run of Christian Alliance and Foreign Missionary Advance, 1890-1896.
